messages.title: Chris Wilford’s 3-point plan for Poplar & Limehouse
messages.content:
This is a national election at a critical moment in our nation's story. I have a three-point plan for Poplar and Limehouse:
1. No extra developments without more doctors' surgeries, transport links and affordable housing
2. Fight for improvements to local schools so our children have the skills they need for a brighter, independent future
3. Crackdown on anti-social behaviour to clear 'boy racers' and drug pushers off our streets

keyPolicies.policyTitle: No extra developments without more doctors' surgeries, transport links and affordable housing
keyPolicies.policyDescription: As your MP, I will be able to talk directly to the Treasury and Government Ministers to get the schools, GP surgeries and transport connections that we need.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Fight for improvements to local schools
keyPolicies.policyDescription: I will work with the Department for Education to ensure that you get those new schools and that those new schools are run by school groups who are rated Outstanding by OFSTED.
I vow to crack down on this behaviour, raising the issue at the highest level of Government to secure action and change on our streets.

endorsements.endorsement: CHRIS WILFORD will be the Conservative Parliamentary Candidate for Poplar and Limehouse in the General Election on Thursday, 8th June 2017. Theresa May's local Conservative candidate, Chris previously stood in 2015 and was the 2014 Conservative candidate for Mayor of Tower Hamlets.

quotes.text: I am thrilled to be standing up for Poplar and Limehouse again. This is a time of great challenge for the UK and only Theresa May and the Conservatives offer strong and stable leadership in the national interest.

Chris has worked tirelessly in Poplar and Limehouse and stood in the 2014 Mayor elections. I am delighted that we have an energetic and passionate candidate to work with us and shire up Theresa May’s Conservative Prime Minister.
